issue_comments.body: Yes, but it still opens and works with VS2010 too, 2012 is surprisingly backwards compatible :)
This project was integrated to Spring.NET 2.0 RC1 release. You can get the release from NuGet (pre-release). So this project's packages are only needed for Spring.NET 1.x series.

issue_comments.body:
Yeah -- we actually have a similar strategy in use elsewhere in the main SPRNET trunk for diff support for 1.1, 2.0, 3.5, 4.0.

Thx for reminding us; I'll add the fix and re-release a minor pt update to include it in the next little bit. 

Thx again,

-Steve B. 
------Original Message------
From: AnthonySteele
To: Stephen Bohlen
Subject: [spring-net-codeconfig] ExtensionAttribute  shold not be redeclared when it is not needed (#2)
Sent: Jun 28, 2011 12:41 PM

Redeclaring the ExtensionAttribute is not always just a "harmless warning" that you can ignore at the cost of being a slob who ignores warnings, it actually prevents some code from building. It's a pain in the neck, same issue as http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4353335/mono-cecil-missing-compiler-required-member-system-runtime-compilerservices-ext and has the same fix.

So I wrapped it in a preprocessor directive. Ensure that the symbol DotNetVersion35 is defined when building for framework V3.5 and up, and the erroneous def. will not be added.

## 

Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-net-codeconfig/pull/2
Merging this as-is but will subsequently rename the IFDEF symbol to NET_3_5 to reflect the same naming convention used in the SPRNET trunk.

Note: this pull request was accepted but by itself its insufficient to support the desired outcome (being able to apply multiple instances of the attribute to the Configuration class and have them actually be processed).  See this JIRA issue for details; additional work will be in progress soon.

https://jira.springsource.org/browse/SPRNETCODECONFIG-2
This issue (https://jira.springsource.org/browse/SPRNETCODECONFIG-2) is now properly resolved in the master branch.
sorry -- accidentally hit CLOSE before doing the merge :)

commits.message: Build script test updates
Update Change log and Breaking Changes

Updates to VS2008 project files
Added old spring-context schema definition

[Component] scanner with the following features:
- adds all classes marked with [Component] or derived attributes into factory
- via [Lazy] attribute define LazyInit
- via [Scope] attribute define the scope of the new spring object
- via [Qualifier] allow fine grained access by autowire
- via [Qualifier] derived attributes allow definition of meta data for the spring object used by autowire
- allow the definition of own NameGenerator for naming a scanned [Component]
Add <context:attribute-config> element to context namespace parser.
Add possibility to have a custom filter which implements ITypeFilter
Add possibility to filter types by assignable, either by implemented interface or extending a specific base type
Add possibility to add attribute filter for including or excluding component classes to scan
Add possibility to filter type class name with reg-expression within XML element <component-scan>
Added base-assemblies attribute to filter assemblies to scan.
Rename <contect:code-config/> into <context:component-scan/>
Rename [Definition] attribute to [ObjectDef]
Update logger names and debug messages to use new lambda expression
Update project documentation for new version
Increase version to 2.0.0
Added AllowMultiple = true to the ImportResourceAttribute.cs as it was missing.
Fixed scope issue with dependencies (Remove CodeConfig dependency to Spring.Aop [SPRNET-1441])
Remove CodeConfig dependency to Spring.Aop [SPRNET-1441]
Minor updates

Minor updates.
Updated syntax highlighting definition for C#.

Redeclaring the ExtensionAttribute is not always just a "harmless warning" that you can ignore at the cost of being a slob who ignores warnings, it actually prevents some code from building. It's a pain in th neck, same issue as http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4353335/mono-cecil-missing-compiler-required-member-system-runtime-compilerservices-ext and has the same fix.
So I wrapped it in a preprocessor directive. Ensure that the symbol DotNetVersion35 is defined when building for framework V3.5 and up, and the erroneous def. will not be added.

issue_comments.body: Thanks for accepting that. I expected my naming convention to be changed.

issue_comments.body: Perhaps integrate code config into Spring.Net completely?

Excellent idea, but I must confess that I like more fluent-config-way as suggested by the project http://nuget.org/packages/FluentSpring.Net, but its just a syntax flavor, anything but xml is welcome!
It was integrated or this project is just abandoned?
